definition: suffix
letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China
horse's tail/pointed posterior section of a locust etc
tail/remainder/remnant/extremity/sixth of the 28 constellations/classifier for fish

sentences.english: OK, then, how many n-grams are in a genetic word?
sentences.chinese: 好，那麼一個基因“單詞”中有幾個“字尾”呢？

definition: phonetic value of a character
(phonology) coda, the part of a syllable that follows its vocalic nucleus (e.g. "u" in kòu or "n" in běn)
vowel
main vowel in diphthong
the final of a Chinese syllable (the component of a syllable remaining after removal of the initial consonant, if any, and the tone, e.g. the final of "niáng" is "iang")
accent (of a word)/stress (on a syllable)
prefix
level or even tone/first and second tones in modern Mandarin
consonant/the initial consonant (of a Chinese syllable)
bisyllable
oblique tone/nonlevel tone/uneven tone (the third tone of Classical Chinese)
falling tone/fourth tone in modern Mandarin
(Chinese linguistics) zero initial (the initial of a syllable that does not begin with a consonant)
entering tone/checked tone/one of the four tones of Middle Chinese
suffix
syllable
